decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly getting your opponent's life total to 10 or less by using the infect mechanic. The key is to play aggressively with creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while utilizing cards like Berserk and Become Immense to pump up their power. Protection spells like Force of Will and Vines of Vastwood help to ensure your creatures can get through to deal infect damage. The deck also includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe to dig for combo pieces and disruption spells like Daze and Spell Pierce to protect your own creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through powerful counter spells and removals, while using card filtering effects to dig for the perfect answers. The deck aims to maintain card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, while also being able to create pressure with creatures like Vendilion Clique and Entreat the Angels. The combination of Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top allows for consistent disruption of opponents' spells. Overall, this UWx Control deck focuses on controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to employ a mix of disruptive spells and aggressive creatures to control the tempo of the game. With a focus on efficiency and early board presence, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistency and maintain a steady stream of threats. Overall, the strategy is to be proactive and proactive in controlling the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Sensei's Divining Top, and Force of Will to counter your opponent's spells. The deck focuses on card advantage and board control through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Terminus to clear the board of threats. The deck also has win conditions in the form of Monastery Mentor and Entreat the Angels to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support a consistent mana curve and to allow for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on utilizing lands to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Life from the Loam, Gamble, and Crop Rotation, the deck can search for key lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Dark Depths to slow down the opponent. Cards like Punishing Fire and Grove of the Burnwillows provide additional control and removal options. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating consistent land advantage and utilizing powerful land-based interactions to grind out wins.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, then using spells like Reanimate and Exhume to bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while utilizing fetch lands to thin the deck and improve consistency. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of card advantage, board control, and disruption. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Counterbalance with Sensei's Divining Top, the player can consistently manipulate the top of their deck and counter or answer their opponent's threats. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to deal with opposing creatures. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent and using efficient spells to control the game until the player can win with a threat like Entreat the Angels.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, card manipulation, and removal spells in order to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on setting up a lock using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top while generating card advantage with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Predict. Monastery Mentor provides a win condition by creating a board presence and pressure. The deck aims to maintain control of the game by answering threats and outvaluing the opponent until it can secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively and disrupt the opponent's game plan using countermagic, removal spells, and efficient creatures. The deck focuses on tempo and card advantage through cards like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Brainstorm. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy by providing access to all necessary colors of mana and the ability to disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland. The deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent early on and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The main idea of this Legacy Aggro - Burn deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to finish them off. Price of Progress and Sulfuric Vortex can also help deal additional damage while disrupting the opponent's mana base. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient damage before they have a chance to stabilize their board or gain life.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, along with disruption and card advantage through cards like Gitaxian Probe and Brainstorm. With a low mana curve and a mix of counter magic and removal spells, the deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan. By combining aggression with disruption, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and secure victories through tempo advantage.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on using a combination of powerful planeswalkers, efficient creatures, and disruptive spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Young Pyromancer, along with powerful removal like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly grinding out a victory. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of versatile spells like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to deal with a range of threats, making it a well-rounded and adaptable control deck in Legacy.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to gain control of the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful interactions with cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top. By controlling the board and manipulating the top of the deck, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through card advantage and strategic plays. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and win conditions like Monastery Mentor further solidify the deck's control game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Sensei's Divining Top, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and manage the board effectively. The inclusion of cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares allows the deck to deal with threats efficiently, while cards like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage provide additional win conditions and value. The deck's mana base is designed to support its spells and maximize consistency.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The key strategy involves using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter spells from the opponent, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional card advantage. Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage provide threats on the board, while cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares help maintain board control. The overall goal is to outlast the opponent and establish a dominant position on the battlefield, leading to victory through attrition.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent spells, utilizing card advantage through draw spells like Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top, and managing the board with removal spells like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also aims to establish a lock with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the top of the opponent's library. Additionally, threats like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide win conditions while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.
